info.headline: Freeze Watch issued January 07 at 7:08PM PST until January 09 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PST THIS EVENING... ...FREEZE WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Wind Advisory, north winds 15 to 30 mph with gusts up to 45 mph. For the Freeze Watch, sub-freezing temperatures as low as 32 possible. * WHERE...Santa Clarita Valley. * WHEN...For the Wind Advisory, until 10 PM PST this evening. For the Freeze Watch, from late Monday night through Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds will blow around unsecured objects and make driving difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. Tree limbs could be blown down and a few power outages may result. Frost and freeze conditions could kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing.
info.instruction: Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects. Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. Plan for extra time to defrost vehicle windshields.
